message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

The paper addresses the problem of word representation in neural-network-based sequence labeling systems, which is a common topic in the natural language processing (NLP) field. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The proposed method involves predicting representations for OOV words, which requires machine learning techniques and could potentially involve deep learning models, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. Additionally, the paper evaluates the proposed method on part-of-speech tagging (POS) and named entity recognition (NER) tasks, which are common tasks in NLP and could fall under cs.CL or cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the method involves using surface-forms and contexts to predict representations, which could involve computer vision techniques and thus make cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a possible sub-category.
